newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: FORECAST- Dutch July inflation seen at 2.0 pct y/y.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST- Dutch July inflation seen at 2.0 pct y/y.

text.p: Bank economists expected Dutch consumer price inflation to edge up to a year-on-year rate of 2.0 percent in July from 1.8 percent in June.
Economists polled by Reuters said annual housing rent increases on July 1 would cause a rise of some 0.3 percent in the consumer price index between July and June.
This was also seen as the main factor behind the rise in the year-on-year inflation rate. The July consumer price data will be published on Friday at 0830 GMT.
Forecasts contributed by: ABN AMRO, ING, Generale Bank, MeesPierson and Rabobank.
